brief_summary.textblock:
The aims of this study were to

        1. investigate what measures were taken when common bile duct stones (CBDS) were found
           intraoperatively in Sweden during the period May 2005 to December 2009 by using data
           from this population-based nationwide registry, and

        2. analyze the outcome in terms of complications and success rates of bile duct clearance
           in relation to various stone sizes and interventions used. In order to further
           characterize the natural course of CBDS of various sizes, particular interest was
           focused on patients with positive findings where no peroperative measures to clear the
           bile ducts were taken or planned postoperatively.

clinical_study.brief_title: Common Bile Duct Stones - Natural History and Interventions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  common bile duct stones

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

study_pop.textblock:
Patients undergoing cholecystectomy with common bile duct stones found in peroperative
        cholangiogram

clinical_study.official_title: Common Bile Duct Stones - Natural History and Interventions : Data From the Swedish Registry for Gallstone Surgery and Endoscopic Retrograde Cholangio Pancreatography (ERCP) (GallRiks)

oversight_info.authority: Sweden: The National Board of Health and Welfare

primary_outcome.description: Complications reported to the registry at 30 day follow up after surgery
primary_outcome.measure: complications in relation to strategy for handling CBDS

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Complications reported to the registry at 30 day follow up after surgery
secondary_outcome.measure: complications in relation to stone size

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
